ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Theodore Robert Fetter  Rob Fetter is an excellent TA! He was accessible and able to explain concepts extremely clearly and concisely. An excellent speaker who thinks carefully about every word that comes out of his mouth and always provides thoughtful answers to questions.
Instructor: Theodore Robert Fetter  Rob Fetter
Instructor: Theodore Robert Fetter  Rob Fetter

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The course itself was excellent - the field trip was great, the internship was great, and I would without hesitation recommend this to all of my fellow students.
The field trips for this course were the result of student initiative and were the most valuable aspects of the course.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The field trip to Alaska and the internship.
Involvement with the UN. Professor was very flexible, the course is very dynamic
The field trips to Alaska and Doha.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: What I would improve would be the class itself. Discussions were often slow and students were frequently not engaged in class discussions because they were sometimes too slow or superficial to be interesting. This is what I would improve out of the class.
I feel that improvements could be made in connecting the background readings, classroom discussion, and field trip experiences.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Theodore Robert Fetter  If I had to give one point of advice, it would be to improve organisational skills. This would enable the TA to keep better track of activities that different students are engaged in at any particular point in time.

Instructor: Theodore Robert Fetter  Rob Fetter was a phenomenal teaching fellow. He both led and participated in our class discussions and field trip experiences. He was able to balance the role of teaching fellow and student incredibly well, and I looked up to him as both a leader and peer.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To gain both background and practical experience in environmental diplomacy from the local to international level.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Massive knowledge about climate change and the governance framework that addresses it. Strengths and weaknesses of this system. Gained hands-on experience with the UN, and the trip to Doha was a superb learning experience as well.
This course both met and exceeded my expectations.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We had excellent group work while preparing for the class trip to Alaska. All members of the group worked together cohesively and were dedicated to ensuring that the trip ran smoothly and that every single member benefitted from having gone on the trip. I was incredibly impressed by the teamwork and dedication that every single group member that went to Alaska displayed.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take the initiative and do things that you are interested in! There is funding available, you just have to come up with ideas and initiatives that you want to dedicate your time to and put effort towards.
Be proactive and engaged--the opportunities this class offers could really change your life.
